questions.question: Which tab in PowerPoint allows you to change the overall look (colors, fonts, effects) of your entire presentation using 'Themes'?
questions.explanation: The Design tab contains the Themes gallery, which applies a consistent design language to all slides.

questions.question: What is a 'Slide Transition'?
options: An animation applied to a specific picture
The visual effect that occurs when you move from one slide to the next
Moving a file to a new folder
questions.explanation: Transitions control the entrance effect of a slide (e.g., Fade, Push, Wipe) as it appears on the screen.

questions.question: The 'Morph' transition is best used to:
options: Create a smooth animation of objects moving or resizing between two similar slides
questions.explanation: Morph recognizes matching objects on two consecutive slides and animates their movement/change seamlessly.

questions.question: Leonardo.AI is an AI-powered tool primarily used for:
questions.explanation: Leonardo.AI is a generative AI platform for creating visual assets like game assets, concept art, and illustrations.

questions.question: If you want your transition to apply to every single slide in the presentation, which button should you click?
questions.explanation: The 'Apply to All' button in the Transitions tab copies the current transition settings to every slide in the deck.

questions.question: Where can you change the Slide Size from Standard (4:3) to Widescreen (16:9)?
questions.explanation: Slide Size options are located on the far right of the Design tab ribbon.

questions.question: What allows you to modify the specific colors and fonts of a selected Theme without changing the theme itself?
questions.explanation: Variants (found next to Themes) allow you to keep the theme structure but swap color palettes or font sets.

questions.question: In the Transitions tab, the 'Duration' setting controls:
options: The speed (time in seconds) of the transition effect itself
questions.explanation: Duration determines how fast or slow the transition effect (e.g., the 'Fade') happens.

questions.question: Which pane in PowerPoint suggests professional layout and design options for your content automatically?
questions.explanation: The Designer (formerly Design Ideas) pane analyzes your content and suggests high-quality slide layouts.

questions.question: Can you add sound to a slide transition (e.g., a drum roll or click)?
options: Yes, using the 'Sound' dropdown in the Transitions tab
Only if you use a microphone
questions.explanation: The Transitions tab includes a Sound option to play a specific audio clip during the slide change.

questions.question: To format the background of a slide with a picture or texture, which command should you use?
questions.explanation: Clicking 'Format Background' in the Design tab opens a pane to set solid colors, gradients, pictures, or patterns as the background.

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of 'Subtle' transition?
questions.explanation: Fade is a standard, subtle transition. Origami, Crush, and Curtains are generally considered 'Exciting' or complex transitions.

questions.question: How do you advance to the next slide if 'On Mouse Click' is unchecked in the Transitions tab?
options: It will only advance automatically after the 'After' time is reached
It advances when you look at it
questions.explanation: If 'On Mouse Click' is disabled, the slide will auto-advance only if a specific time is set in the 'After' box.

questions.question: What is the key requirement for the Morph transition to work effectively?
options: The slides must be different colors
You need two consecutive slides with at least one common object (duplicated and moved)
You need to delete the text
questions.explanation: Morph requires a starting slide and an ending slide (usually a duplicate) where objects have been moved or resized.

questions.question: Which feature helps you match the slide colors to a specific logo color?
questions.explanation: The Eyedropper tool allows you to sample a color from an image (like a logo) and apply it to shapes or text.

questions.question: If you apply a background to one slide, how can you make it appear on every slide?
options: Click 'Apply to All' in the Format Background pane
Copy and paste the slide 100 times
questions.explanation: The Format Background pane has an 'Apply to All' button to set the current background for the entire presentation.

questions.question: [Digital Skill] Why might you use AI image generation for a presentation?
options: To make the file size larger
To create unique, copyright-free visuals that perfectly match your specific topic
questions.explanation: AI tools allow for the creation of bespoke imagery that fits specific themes where generic stock photos might fail.

questions.question: Which transition effect mimics the turning of a page in a book?
questions.explanation: Page Curl (or Peel Off) is an exciting transition that looks like a physical page turning.

questions.question: The 'Effect Options' button next to the Transition gallery allows you to:
options: Change the direction or variation of the selected transition (e.g., Wipe from Left vs Wipe from Right)
Change the color of the text
questions.explanation: Effect Options refine the behavior of the active transition, such as changing direction or shape.

questions.question: Which view is best for checking how your transitions look and flow?
questions.explanation: Slide Show or Reading View plays the actual animations and transitions so you can preview the final experience.
